text: Where is your husband, Mrs. Smith?

text: Do you know where his ticket is?

I didn’t come because I was ill.

He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.

text: They didn’t come because they missed the train.
translate: Nem jöttek el, mert lekésték a vonatot.

text: I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.
translate: Nem jöttem el, mert nem volt szabad.

text: He is staying in a hotel.
He is staying in a cheap hotel.
He is reading a boring novel.
She is watching an exciting movie.
I am wearing a blue dress.
I am wearing a red dress.
I am wearing a green dress.
An old lady lives at the top.
translate: Ott, fent egy idős nő lakik.

text: A fat lady lives at the top.
translate: Ott, fent egy kövér nő lakik.
Ott, lent egy kíváncsi nő lakik.

text: But the neighbours have naughty children.
translate: De a szomszédoknak szemtelen gyerekei vannak.

text: I am not coming because the weather is so bad.
translate: Nem jövök, mert olyan rossz az idő.

text: He isn’t coming because he isn’t invited.
translate: Nem jön, mert nem hívták meg.

text: I am not coming because I have no time.
I am not staying because I still have to work.
translate: Nem maradok, mert még dolgoznom kell.

text: I’m going because it is already late.
I am a member of a sports club.
There is a football / soccer (am.) stadium in our city.
There is also a swimming pool with a sauna.
And there is a golf course.
There is a football / soccer (am.) match on now.
The German team is playing against the English one.
translate: A német csapat az angol ellen játszik.

text: I was talking on the phone all the time.
Did you have to call an ambulance?
Did you have to call the doctor?
Did you have to call the police?
Do you have the telephone number? I had it just now.
translate: Megvan a telefonszám? Az előbb még megvolt.

text: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
translate: Megvan a cím? Az előbb még megvolt.

text: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.
translate: Megvan a várostérkép? Az előbb még megvolt.

text: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
translate: Pontosan jött? Nem tudott pontosan jönni.

text: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
translate: Megtalálta az utat? Nem tudta megtalálni az utat.

text: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
Why could you not come on time?
Why could you not find the way?
translate: Miért nem tudtad megtalálni az utat?

text: Why could you not understand him?
I could not come on time because there were no buses.
translate: Nem tudtam pontosan jönni, mert nem jött busz.

text: I could not find the way because I had no city map.
translate: Nem tudtam megtalálni az utat, mert nem volt várostérképem.

text: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.
translate: Nem tudtam megérteni, mert olyan hangos volt a zene.

text: I had to take a taxi.
I had to buy a city map.
I had to switch off the radio.
Why aren’t you eating the cake?
I’m not eating it because I must lose weight.
translate: Nem eszem, mert le kell fogynom.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the beer?
I’m not drinking it because I have to drive.
translate: Nem iszom, mert még vezetnem kell.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the coffee?
I’m not drinking it because it is cold.
Why aren’t you drinking the tea?
I’m not drinking it because I don’t have any sugar.
Why aren’t you eating the soup?
I’m not eating it because I didn’t order it.
Why don’t you eat the meat?
I’m not eating it because I am a vegetarian.
I know that – I knew that.
I write that – I wrote that.
I hear that – I heard that.
I’ll get it – I got it.
I’ll bring that – I brought that.
I’ll buy that – I bought that.
translate: Én megveszem ezt – Én megvettem ezt.

text: I expect that – I expected that.
translate: Én elvárom ezt – Én elvártam ezt.

text: I’ll explain that – I explained that.
translate: Én megmagyarázom ezt – Én megmagyaráztam ezt.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Én ismerem ezt – Én ismertem ezt.

text: How did you pass the exam?
How did you find the way?
With whom did you make an appointment?
With whom did you celebrate your birthday?
What did you come to know?
You are so lazy – don’t be so lazy!
translate: Olyan lusta vagy – ugyan, ne legyél olyan lusta!

text: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!
translate: Olyan sokat alszol – ugyan, ne aludj olyan sokáig!

text: You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
translate: Olyan későn jössz – ugyan, ne gyere már olyan későn!

text: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
translate: Olyan hangosan nevetsz – ugyan, ne nevess már olyan hangosan!

text: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!
translate: Olyan halkan beszélsz – ugyan, ne beszélj már olyan halkan!

text: You drink too much – don’t drink so much!
translate: Túl sokat iszol – ugyan, ne igyál már olyan sokat!

text: You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!
translate: Túl sokat dohányzol – ugyan, ne dohányozz már olyan sokat!

text: You work too much – don’t work so much!
translate: Túl sokat dolgozol – ugyan, ne dolgozz már olyan sokat!

text: You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
translate: Túl gyorsan vezetsz – ugyan, ne vezess már olyan gyorsan!

text: My son did not want to play with the doll.
translate: A fiam nem akart a babával játszani.

text: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).
My wife did not want to play chess with me.
translate: A feleségem nem akart velem sakkozni.

text: My children did not want to go for a walk.
They did not want to tidy the room.
They did not want to go to bed.

text: He was not allowed to eat chocolate.

text: He was not allowed to eat sweets.

Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?

text: During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.

text: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
They were allowed to stay up late.
Which newspaper did you subscribe to?
Why did you become a teacher?

He was disloyal, but she was loyal.
translate: Ő (férfi) hűtlen volt, de ő (nő) hűséges volt.

text: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.
translate: Ő (férfi) lusta volt, de ő (nő) szorgalmas volt.

text: He was poor, but she was rich.
translate: Ő (férfi) szegény volt, de ő (nő) gazdag volt.

text: He had no money, only debts.
He had no luck, only bad luck.
He had no success, only failure.
He was not satisfied, but dissatisfied.
He was not happy, but sad.
He was not friendly, but unfriendly.

translate: Vedd meg ezt! Vegye meg ezt!

text: Since when is she no longer working?
Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
Since they have met each other, they are happy.
Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: Amióta gyerekük van, ritkán mennek szórakozni.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
She listens to music while she does her work.
translate: Zenét hallgat, miközben megcsinálja a feladatait.

text: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: Nem látok semmit, mikor nincs szemüvegem.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: Nem értek semmit, mikor a zene ilyen hangos.

text: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: Nem érzek semmit, mikor meg vagyok fázva.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: Egy taxit hívunk, mikor esik az eső.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: Körbeutazzuk a világot, ha nyerünk a lottón.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: Elkezdjük az evést, ha nem jön hamarosan.

text: I’m angry that you drink so much beer.
translate: Engem bosszant, hogy olyan sok sört iszol.

text: I’m angry that you come so late.
translate: Engem bosszant, hogy olyan későn jössz.

text: I think he needs a doctor.
translate: Azt hiszem, hogy orvosra van szüksége.

text: I think he is sleeping now.
We hope that he marries our daughter.
We hope that he has a lot of money.
We hope that he is a millionaire.
I heard that your wife had an accident.
translate: Hallottam, hogy a feleségednek volt egy balesete.

text: I heard that she is in the hospital.
I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
translate: Hallottam, hogy az autód teljesen tönkrement.

text: I’m happy that you are interested.
I’m happy that you want to buy the house.
translate: Örülök, hogy ön a házat meg akarja venni.

text: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
translate: Félek, hogy az utolsó busz már elment.

text: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
I’m afraid I have no more money.
He fell asleep although the TV was on.
translate: Elaludt, habár a televízió be volt kapcsolva.

text: He stayed a while although it was late.
translate: Még maradt, habár már késő volt.

text: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
translate: A televízió be volt kapcsolva. Ennek ellenére elaludt.

text: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
translate: Már késő volt. Ennek ellenére maradt még.

text: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
translate: Megbeszéltük. Ennek ellenére nem jött el.

text: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
translate: Holott jeges az út, gyorsan vezet.

text: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
translate: Nincs jogosítványa. Ennek ellenére vezet autót.

text: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
translate: Az út jeges. Ennek ellenére ilyen gyorsan vezet.

text: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
translate: Be van rúgva. Ennek ellenére kerékpározik.

text: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
translate: Nem talál magának állást, jóllehet egyetemen tanult.

text: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Nem megy az orvoshoz, noha fájdalmai vannak.

text: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
translate: Vásárol egy autót, noha nincs pénze.

text: She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
translate: Egyetemen tanult. Ennek ellenére nem talál állást.

text: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Fájdalmai vannak. Ennek ellenére nem megy el orvoshoz.

text: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
translate: Nincs pénze. Ennek ellenére vásárol egy autót.

text: Perhaps the weather will get better tomorrow.
translate: Az idő talán jobb lesz holnap.

text: I hope that it gets better.
Do you know that for sure?
I think that it is old.

translate: Sőt úgy találom, hogy nagyon jól néz ki.

text: The boss definitely has a girlfriend.
It is very possible that he has a girlfriend.
I don’t know if he loves me.
I don’t know if he’ll come back.
I don’t know if he’ll call me.
I wonder if he thinks about me.
I wonder if he has someone else.
Maybe he tells me the truth?
I doubt whether he really likes me.
I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
I doubt whether he’ll marry me.
The button from the shirt is gone.
The boss’ computer is not working.
How do I get to her parents’ house?
translate: Hogyan jutok el a szülei házához?

text: The house is at the end of the road.
translate: A ház az utca végén áll.

text: What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?

translate: Mikor van a gyermekeknek tanítási szünetük?

text: What are the doctor’s consultation times?
translate: Mikor van rendelési ideje az orvosnak?

text: What time is the museum open?
translate: Mikor van a nyitvatartási ideje a múzeumnak?

text: The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
translate: A kirándulás szép volt ugyan, de túl megerőltető.

text: The train was on time, but too full.
translate: A vonat pontos volt ugyan, de túl zsúfolt.

text: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
translate: A hotel kényelmes volt ugyan, de túl drága.

text: He’ll take either the bus or the train.
He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
translate: Vagy ma este jön, vagy holnap reggel.

text: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
translate: Vagy nálunk lakik, vagy a szállodában.

text: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
She knows Spain as well as England.
He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
translate: Ő nem csak buta, hanem lusta is.

text: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
translate: Ő nem csak csinos, hanem intelligens is.

text: She speaks not only German, but also French.
translate: Ő nem csak németül beszél, hanem franciául is.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: Nem tudok sem zongorázni, sem gitározni.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: Nem tudok sem keringőzni, sem szambát táncolni.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: Nem szeretem sem az operát, sem a balettet.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: Minél gyorsabban dolgozol, annál hamarabb készen leszel.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: Minél korábban jössz, annál hamarabb mehetsz.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
translate: Minél öregebb lesz az ember, annál kényelmesebb is lesz.

text: I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
I become tired as soon as I have to study.
I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
translate: Abbahagyom a munkát, amint 60 éves leszek.

text: As soon as I have a moment.
He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
translate: Felhív, amint egy kis ideje lesz.

text: I’ll work as long as I can.
I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
translate: Én dolgozni fogok, amíg egészséges vagyok.

text: He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: Az ágyban fekszik ahelyett, hogy dolgozna.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: A kocsmában ül, ahelyett, hogy hazajönne.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: Amennyire én tudom, a felesége beteg.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Lekéstem a buszt, egyébként pontos lettem volna.

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Nem találtam meg az utat, egyébként pontos lettem volna.

text: Have you already been to Berlin?
No, I don’t know anyone here.
a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
No, I won’t stay here much longer.
translate: Nem, már nem sokáig maradok itt.

text: Would you like to drink something else?
No, I don’t want anything else.
No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
Does anyone else want a coffee?
I’ll wait until my hair is dry.
I’ll wait until the film is over.
I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
translate: Igen, mielőtt megkezdődik a nyári szünet.

text: Repair the roof before the winter begins.
translate: Javítsd ki a tetőt, mielőtt elkezdődik / megjön a tél.

text: Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
translate: Moss kezet, mielőtt az asztalhoz ülsz.

text: Close the window before you go out.
translate: Csukd be az ablakot, mielőtt kimész.

text: Yes, after the class is over.
After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
translate: Miután balesete volt, nem tudott többé dolgozni.

text: After he had lost his job, he went to America.

text: After he went to America, he became rich.
We had to water the flowers.
We had to clean the apartment.
We had to wash the dishes.

Who had to take the train?
We did not want to stay long.
We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
I just wanted to call a taxi.

text: I thought you wanted to call information.

text: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.
